name: Robert Smithson
biography:
Born in Rutherford, New Jersey on 2 January 1938 as Robert Irving Smithson.  
Education: Art Students' League, New York 1953; Brooklyn Museum, New York 1956.
Joined Army Reserve Force in 1956.  Known as Earth Sculptor, he purchased island off of Maine and site in Utah in 1971-72.  Lecturer in painting at Police Athletic League, New York 1959; visiting lecturer at University of New Mexico, Alburquerque 1973.
Recipient: Art Institute of Chicago Award 1972.  Died in airplane crash in Amarillo, Texas on July 20, 1973.
